page.title: 09Transport in New Mills
page.content: Trains in New Mills carry two loads, they are passengers and goods. There are three railways:the goods, the Buxton to Manchester line and the Central Station which goes right through the valley.Bus services:358, 360, 361, 362.Buses come to the train station so if you get off at Newtown you can get on the bus. New Mills has it's own bus station. Every Monday we go swimming on a coach. I think that Bowers is the most common coach service in New Mills. The canal is next to the Manchester to Buxton line. There is no cargo carried on it but plenty of barges. I have joined Furness Vale Sea Scouts. We canoe on the canal. The A6 is a major trunk road running through New Mills. The A6 is next to the Manchester to Buxton line which is next to the canal.
